name: Assessing Chance in Neuro-Vascular Interactions
citation: Aksenov, Daniil (2025) Assessing Chance in Neuro-Vascular Interactions (Version 0.251225.2239) [Data set]. DANDI Archive. https://doi.org/10.48324/dandi.001689/0.251225.2239
description: This Dandiset contains invasive neurophysiology and tissue oxygen recordings collected in awake, restrained rabbits during 10-minute resting-state sessions, supporting the analyses in “Assessing Chance in Neuro-Vascular Interactions.” The dataset is intended for studying neurovascular interactions/vasomotion and for reproducing the surrogate-based statistical framework used in the manuscript. This dandiset contains data from 43 resting-state experiments (10 minutes each) consisting of simultaneous brain tissue PO₂ recordings and neuronal activity measures (LFP band envelopes and/or single-unit activity). Experiments were performed in 11 pigmented Dutch-belted rabbits; see the associated manuscript for subject details and experimental context.
